title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2C.14 - Advisory Exit and Ramp Speed Signs (W13-2 and W13-3)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 2C.14 - Advisory Exit and Ramp Speed Signs (W13-2 and W13-3)

State Regulations
DELETE Paragraphs 04, 07, 08, and Figure 2C-3. INSERT the following paragraphs and Figure NY2C-3: Guidance: 05A The Advisory Ramp Speed sign should be used only on a
ramp that is not an exit ramp, or on an exit ramp for a curve that is
downstream of the initial curve. Option: 06A Where there is a need to remind road users of the
recommended advisory speed, a Combination Horizontal Alignment/Advisory Speed
sign (W1-1a or W1-2a) sign may be installed at or beyond the beginning of the
exit curve or on the outside of the curve, provided that it is obvious that the
sign applies only to exiting traffic. These signs may also be used at
intermediate points along the ramp, especially if the ramp curvature changes
and the subsequent curves on the ramp have a different advisory speed than the
initial exit curve. Support: 06B Figure NY2C-3 shows an example of advisory speed
signing for an exit ramp. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
2C.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
